result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: signed and filed.
Court appointed Attorney Kerri Cleghorn to represent the defense.

Defendant Brandon Montrez Northern appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status of counsel.  Defendant has not hired an attorney.  Court will appoint an attorney at county expense.  Case is adjourned to 11-11-22 at 1:30 pm for status of counsel by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:

Defendant Brandon Montrez Northern appeared by video.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Brandon Montrez Northern.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.  Defendant is requesting that Attorney Ritter withdraw from the case. Attorney Ritter is privately retained.  Court granted request for Attorney Ritter to withdraw.  Case is adjourned to 10-11-22 at 1:30 pm for status of counsel by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of her client.

Defendant Brandon Montrez Northern in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BOTH APPEAR BY VIDEO.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brandon Montrez Northern in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Brandon Montrez Northern in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandon Montrez Northern appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 35.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
